newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia money market rate up to 12.2 from 11.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatia money market rate up to 12.2 from 11.3 pct.

text.p: Croatia's average money market rate rose to 12.2 percent on Friday from 11.3 percent, despite a better supply of kuna meeting borrowers' demand.
Today's trade left a surplus of some 15 million kuna after 53.8 million kuna settlements following tight pre-Christmas liquidity. Of this, 38.2 million were fresh borrowings and the rest rolled over.
The interbank rates ranged between 11 percent for call money and 17 percent for term loans. Insurers charged a steady 9.0 percent.
The central bank calculated the kuna midrates for Saturday and Sunday weaker at 5.5327 against the dollar and at 3.5610 to the German mark.
